senses.de: Recognize or be able to name someone or something
senses.ex: She was able to identify the thief by his distinctive tattoo.

Tips.title: Visual Recognition
Tips.description: Used when you recognize someone or something by seeing.
Tips.example: Can you identify your bag among these?

Tips.title: Specific Feature
Tips.description: Emphasize identifying by a unique trait or feature.
Tips.example: The bird was identified by its colorful feathers.

senses.de: Associate or establish (someone) as being a particular person or thing
senses.ex: She was able to identify herself as the owner of the car.

Tips.title: Self-Association
Tips.description: About proving or clarifying one's own identity, often officially.

Tips.title: Official Verification
Tips.description: Used in situations where you need to prove something definitely.
Tips.example: Investigators worked to identify the cause of the fire.

senses.de: Find out or establish exactly who or what someone or something is
senses.ex: Researchers have identified a number of factors contributing to obesity.

Tips.title: Research Precision
Tips.description: In academic or professional contexts for precise identification.
Tips.example: The scientist identified a new species.

Tips.title: Analytical Context
Tips.description: When analyzing to draw specific conclusions or insights.
Tips.example: The survey helped to identify key market trends.

senses.de: Regard oneself as sharing the same beliefs or nature as someone else
senses.ex: He identifies strongly with his grandmother's struggle.

Tips.title: Emotional Connection
Tips.description: Denotes a strong emotional or personal connection to something.
Tips.example: She identifies closely with her cultural heritage.

Tips.title: Shared Beliefs
Tips.description: When you feel you share common beliefs or feelings with others.
Tips.example: He identifies with the environmental movement.

senses.de: Associate someone or something closely with; regard as having strong links with
senses.ex: Many people identify love with happiness.

Tips.title: Conceptual Link
Tips.description: Shows a strong conceptual or symbolic connection between ideas.
Tips.example: The novel identifies fate with the sea's ebb and flow.

Tips.title: Psychological Association
Tips.description: Used in psychology to discuss how people connect ideas or feelings.
Tips.example: Patients often identify stress with physical symptoms.

Classify.wordDefinition:
Classify means to group things or objects based on their similarities or differences. For example, we can classify animals into different groups like mammals, birds, reptiles, etc.

In simpler terms, classify is used when we want to group similar things together, while identify is used when we want to recognize or distinguish one thing from others.

Determine.wordDefinition:
Determine means to come to a decision about something or make a final choice after examining all the evidence presented.

Both words are applicable in different contexts. You can determine the cause of a problem or determine the best course of action.

Both words involve reasoning, but determine is more about making a choice, and identify is more about recognizing or defining something.

Diagnose.wordDefinition:
Diagnose is used to refer to the process of examining a patient's symptoms in order to determine what illness or medical condition they have.

Diagnose is used when talking about determining a medical condition, while identify is used when talking about recognizing or naming something in general.

Discern.wordDefinition:
Discern means to perceive or recognize something through close observation or scrutiny.

For example, you might discern a hidden meaning in a poem or discern the true intentions of a politician.

Discern means to understand something through careful observation, while identify means to label or recognize something based on its characteristics.

Distinguish.wordDefinition:
Distinguish means to recognize or perceive the difference between two or more things. For example, if you are distinguishing between two similar-looking items, you are able to tell them apart.

In simpler terms, distinguishing is about telling apart things that are similar, while identifying is about recognizing or naming something.

Establish.wordDefinition:
Establish means to create or set up something that didn't exist before.

This word is used when starting something new, like establishing a new business, organization, or a relationship.

Establish means to create, while identify means to recognize.

Pinpoint.wordDefinition:
Pinpoint means to locate or determine the exact position of something or someone.

This word is usually used when you need to find something precisely, such as a location or a specific item in a store. For example, if you're trying to find a particular store in a busy shopping center, you might ask for directions to help you pinpoint its exact location.

Recognize.wordDefinition:
The words identify and recognize are often used interchangeably, but there is a subtle difference.

Recognize means to remember or acknowledge something that you have experienced or encountered before. For example, you might recognize a friend's face when you see them in a crowd, or you might recognize a song that you heard on the radio earlier in the day.

Identify is about determining something's characteristics or features, while recognize is about remembering or acknowledging something you've encountered before.

Verify.wordDefinition:
Verify means to check if something or someone is genuine or true. This involves examining evidence or facts to make sure that it is accurate.

For instance, you can verify a person's identity by checking their ID card.

The word identify is used when you are recognizing something, while verify is used when you are making sure that something is true or real.

quotes.Text: Studies have identified a significant 'skills gap' between what students are currently being taught and the skills employers are seeking in today's global economy. Our children must be better prepared than they are now to meet the future challenges of our ever-changing world.
quotes.Title: American Educator
quotes.Name: Stephen Covey

quotes.Text: I think women want freedom. They want to be empowered. They want hope. They want love; they want all the things that I want, and I'm not afraid to say those things and act on them, and I think that's why they identify with me.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Rihanna

quotes.Text: Many people in this world are still so identified with every thought that arises in their head. There is not the slightest space of awareness there.
quotes.Title: German Speaker
quotes.Name: Eckhart Tolle

quotes.Text: I have a very sensitive nose. I identify with dogs. I understand the world through my nose.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Erica Jong

quotes.Text: I will forever and always identify with Scarborough - no matter where I move.
quotes.Title: Canadian Comedian
quotes.Name: Lilly Singh

quotes.Text: I don't have time to worry about who I admire or who I identify with.
quotes.Title: American First Lady
quotes.Name: Pat Nixon

quotes.Text: I think people throughout the world identify with my characters.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Sidney Sheldon

quotes.Text: It's fun to play a character that you can identify with.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Sriti Jha

quotes.Text: I identify in some measure with each of my characters.
quotes.Title: Indian Writer
quotes.Name: Amitava Kumar

quotes.Text: Television is about identifying with the characters.
quotes.Title: Indian Producer
quotes.Name: Ekta Kapoor
